title: What is JavaScript?

options.a: A programming language that allows you to implement complex features on web pages

title: Who developed JavaScript?

options.a: Google

title: What is the primary use of JavaScript in web development?

options.a: Creating and enhancing the interactive features of a website

title: How do you declare a variable in JavaScript?

options.a: var myVariable;

title: What is the 'DOM' in JavaScript?

options.a: A way to control access to your JavaScript application
options.b: Document Object Model, a programming interface for web documents

title: How do you add a comment in JavaScript?

options.a: // This is a comment

title: What is an 'if' statement in JavaScript used for?

options.a: A way to control access to your JavaScript application
options.b: To execute a block of code if a specified condition is true

title: How do you create a function in JavaScript?

options.a: function myFunction() {}

title: What is 'NaN' in JavaScript?

options.a: A way to control access to your JavaScript application

title: How do you define an array in JavaScript?

options.a: array myArray = [];

title: What is the purpose of the 'for' loop in JavaScript?

options.a: A way to control access to your JavaScript application
options.b: To execute a block of code multiple times, with different values

title: How do you access the first element of an array 'myArray' in JavaScript?

options.a: myArray.firstElement;

title: What is 'JSON' in JavaScript?

options.a: A way to control access to your JavaScript application
options.b: JavaScript Object Notation, a lightweight data interchange format

title: What is 'AJAX' in JavaScript used for?

options.a: A way to control access to your JavaScript application
options.b: To make asynchronous requests to a server to retrieve or send data without reloading the page

title: How do you create an object in JavaScript?

options.a: object myObject = {};

title: What is 'localStorage' in JavaScript used for?

options.a: A way to control access to your JavaScript application
options.b: To store key-value pairs in a web browser with no expiration time

title: How do you define a constant in JavaScript?

options.a: const myConstant = 10;

title: What is the 'switch' statement in JavaScript used for?

options.a: A way to control access to your JavaScript application
options.b: To execute different code blocks based on different conditions

title: How do you compare two values for equality in JavaScript?

options.a: value1 == value2;

title: What is a 'closure' in JavaScript?

options.a: A way to control access to your JavaScript application
options.b: A function that has access to variables from its containing function, even after that function has finished executing

title: How do you round a number 'x' to the nearest integer in JavaScript?

options.a: round(x);

title: What is the 'typeof' operator in JavaScript used for?

options.a: A way to control access to your JavaScript application
options.b: To determine the type of a value or variable

title: How do you convert a string 'str' to an integer in JavaScript?

options.a: parseInt(str);

title: What is the 'try...catch' statement in JavaScript used for?

options.a: A way to control access to your JavaScript application
options.b: To handle errors and exceptions in code

title: How do you add an element to the end of an array 'myArray' in JavaScript?

options.a: myArray.append(element);

title: What is 'ECMAScript' in JavaScript?

options.a: A way to control access to your JavaScript application
options.b: A scripting-language specification that is the basis for JavaScript

title: How do you get the current date and time in JavaScript?

options.a: currentDateTime();
